TopicTitle: StuntKAT [VTOL] [FAR BALANCED] [EASY FLYING] - Now with patented [JEB EJECTION SEAT]

Articles.Content:
Long-time Lurker/Builder, First Time Poster

I present, below, the all-stock, [.25] StuntKAT [Colored with the amazing KerbalPaint]

Maneuverable, fun, in-atmo VTOL that does loops and looks good doing it.

Balanced for FAR (it can fly without it, but needs to be tweaked)

No-clipping debug used (but frankly that matters little these days)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

[DOWNLOAD]

Design Goal:

Was to form the holy trinity: form, function and maneuverability. Whether I succeeded or failed is up to you.

  • Easy to fly as I have not been able to flat-spin her and not recover.
  • Stall speed of about 60 m/s
  • 25km flight ceiling
  • Mach 4.7 Max speed
  • VTOL capable, but not easy to fly, practice is needed with feathering the lower-rear jet-engine, especially landing.

The Fun STUFF:

By sheer accident, I managed to create an ejection system that ejects the MK1 cockpit without blowing the entire craft tied into the "abort" button

  • Jeb will be ejected with the MK1 cockpit out of the craft and the chute will trigger
  • Control of the craft will be taken over by your own [R2-D2] Sputnik drone and you can continue flying the craft after ejection by just press ]
  • [R2-D2] craft will be more maneuverable as Jeb's weight is shed.
  • Setup to use spoilers as flaps, helps in landing her under vertical thrust [look at action groups]
  • Will fly itself and make parabolic loops when flown with TurboJet and Reg-Jet engine [action groups 1,3]

Thing to do with it:

  • Makes an excellent base for SSTOs. I have several variants already and can get to the Mun, land and back with the addition of a few fuel tanks, but not perfected.
  • Add another engine to the engine block to create a high altitude 1.8km/s flyer.
  • Eject Jeb into space or other things, you get quite some distance on him.
  • If you do not understand my building techniques, it is a good training .craft
  • If you far surpass me, you can laugh at my mistakes or better suggest upgrades.

ENJOY!

Edited November 21, 2014 by metadomino
I have no idea how the ejector would work but I plan to find out.
That looks pretty good. I am curious on how the ejecting seat works now.

Jeb^3 and Spartwo,

Tell me if everything works correctly for you. Curious to see how it flies for you guys as well. I now realize that I have no idea what "easy flying" is.

M
